definition: to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
to gather one's spirits/to pull oneself together
to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
to shake out/to bring to light/to squander
TikTok, app for creating and sharing short videos
to shake uncontrollably/to jiggle (one's leg etc)

sentences.english: Into a ball in the mud.
In the comic dialogue, two performers revealed the joke suddenly, which made the audience convulse with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 相聲演員不時抖包袱，令現場觀衆捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: The news sent a shudder through the audience.
sentences.chinese: 這消息使聽衆激動得直髮抖。

sentences.english: Sink to eradicate to peruse with gentleman tiny trembled to quiver towards seeing one eye all bad coldly.
sentences.chinese: 沉消和君閱微對視一眼都惡寒的抖了抖。

sentences.english: Sink to eradicate to peruse with gentleman tiny trembled to quiver towards seeing one eye all bad coldly.
sentences.chinese: 沉消和君閱微對視一眼都惡寒的抖了抖。

sentences.english: He shuddered when he saw the dead animal.
sentences.chinese: 他看見這隻死動物時，直髮抖。

sentences.english: She knew how to jump that. Annabel quivered.
sentences.chinese: 她知道該怎麼跳，可安娜貝利則發起了抖。

sentences.english: It's absolutely appalling, I'm trembling with anger.
sentences.chinese: 這絕對是駭人聽聞的，我氣得直髮抖。

sentences.english: Did you notice my hand shaking.
sentences.chinese: 你沒注意到我的手在抖嗎？

sentences.english: Before I had heard a dozen words, I was trembling with fear .
sentences.chinese: 只聽他說幾句話，我就嚇得直髮抖。

sentences.english: I remember that your hand was shaking.
Just as the maker said, the shutter velocity is not enough for helding by hand.
sentences.chinese: 正如作者說道，由於手持，還是有些抖了。

sentences.english: You're so jittery that people use your hands to blend their margaritas.
sentences.chinese: 你抖得如此厲害以使別人用你的手來調馬格麗塔酒。

sentences.english: The boy was shaking with fear.
Take your coat out of doors and shake it out.
sentences.chinese: 把你的外衣拿到門外去抖乾淨。

definition: to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
